entry.lex: The leader of Azerbaijan is called the Prime Minister of Azerbaijan. The capital of Azerbaijan is Baku. In Baku is the Baku Turkish Martyrs's Memorial located which was designed by Huseyin Butuner and Hilmi Guner. Turk Sehitler Aniti is the native name for the Baku Turkish Martyr's Memorial, which is dedicated to the Ottoman Army soldiers killed in the Battle of Baku. The source of legislature in Azerbaijan is the National Assembly.

Le chef de l'Azerbaïdjan est appelé Premier Ministre de l'Azerbaïdjan. La capitale de l'Azerbaïdjan est Bakou. A Bakou se trouve le Mémorial des Martyrs turcs de Bakou, conçu par Huseyin Butuner et Hilmi Guner. Turk Sehitler Aniti est le nom d'origine du Mémorial des Martyrs turcs de Bakou, dédié aux soldats de l'armée ottomane tués lors de la bataille de Bakou. La source du pouvoir législatif en Azerbaïdjan est l'Assemblée nationale.

The capital of Baku is Azerbaijan with its leader called the Prime Minister and its legislative branch called the National Assembly. The Baku Turkish Martyrs Memorial was designed by Huseyin Butuner and Hilmi Guner and is found in Azerbaijan. It is dedicated to soldiers killed in the Battle of Baku. The Memorial is known locally as Türk Şehitleri Anıtı.

La capitale de Bakou est l'Azerbaïdjan avec son chef appelé le Premier ministre et son organe législatif appelé l'Assemblée nationale. Le mémorial des martyrs turcs de Bakou a été conçu par Huseyin Butuner et Hilmi Guner et se trouve en Azerbaïdjan. Il est dédié aux soldats tués lors de la bataille de Bakou. Le mémorial est connu localement sous le nom de Türk Şehitleri Anıtı.

A Bakou se trouve un mémorial des martyrs dédié aux soldats tués lors de la bataille de Bakou. Le nom natif est Turk Sehitleri Aniti. Le mémorial a été conçu par Hüseyin Bütüner et Hilmi Güner.

The city is the location of the Baku Turkish Martyrs memorial which was designed by Huseyin Butuner and Hilmi Guner in red granite and white marble. The memorial is dedicated to the soldiers of the Ottoman army who died in the Battle of Baku.

Dead Mans Plack is a rock formation found in England and dedicated to Aethelwald, Ealdorman of East Anglia. One of the ethnic groups of the country are the British Arabs, and the Church of England is the official religion. The Cornish language is still spoken in parts of the country.

Dead Mans Plack est une formation rocheuse d'Angleterre dédiée à Aethelwald, Ealdorman d'East Anglia. Un des groupes ethniques du pays sont les Arabes Britanniques, et l'Eglise d'Angleterre est la religion officielle. La langue cornique est encore parlée dans certaines régions du pays.

Dead Man's Plack is located in England, made from stone, and dedicated to AEthelwald, Ealdorman of East Anglia. England's established religion is The Church of England, and the capital city is London. The Cornish language is spoken there, and the British Arabs are an English ethnic group.

The 14th New Jersey Volunteer Infantry Monument is found in the Monocacy National Battlefield, Frederick County, Maryland. Located near to the city of Frederick, the monument was established on 11th July 1907, is owned by the National Park Service and belongs to the category of Historic districts in the United States.

Situé près de la ville de Frederick, le monument a été érigé le 11 juillet 1907 ; il appartient au National Park Service et fait partie de la catégorie des districts historiques aux États-Unis.
